item.title: The Fed’s interest-rate cuts are fueling a stock market ‘melt-up’ — and ruin for some investors
item.description: A buildup in leverage would make the financial system more vulnerable and susceptible to shocks.

item.title: Inside the zero-revenue nuclear stock whose 1,500% rally is shaking up the AI trade
item.description: Now worth $20 billion, Oklo has become the largest pre-revenue company listed in the U.S., as investors search for the next big AI trade.

item.title: I’m 66. My mortgage is $250K and the rate is 3.4%. Would it be foolish to pay it off from my $770K investments?
item.description: “I don’t plan on taking Social Security until 70 and I will have one other small pension.”

item.title: ‘I changed my will to deter vultures’: I’m in my 60s and disabled. Do I impoverish myself to qualify for Medicaid?
item.description: “I pay my taxes and insurance, donate money and personal belongings.”

item.title: Why Big Tech’s tiny production costs make it a long term winner, says this fund manager
item.description: AOT Growth and Innovation ETF portfolio manager, John Tinsman says there’s one clear reason to invest in big tech companies: low marginal cost.
